subject: Re: [junit] Perform something before and after a complete test
msgSnippet: haefeleuser wrote:  ... Why do you test your persistence layer domain object by domain object? Don t you have some generalized persistence mechanism
messageBody:
haefeleuser wrote:

<snip />
> Rainsberger, you write you consider using tearDown() a smell. We use
> this method for our persistance layer tests. For each entity (like
> Article, Supplier and so on) we have a test case class with methods
> like testCreateArticle, testUpdateArticle, testDeleteArticle,
> testGetArticleById, testArticleIdValidation and so on. The tearDown
> () deletes the created entities. So it is not just something like
> instanceVariable = null. I don't consider tearDown() as code smell.

Why do you test your persistence layer domain object by domain object?
Don't you have some generalized persistence mechanism that you can test
/once/, then use forever? Test your persistence mechanism without your
domain, so it works for /any/ domain objects. You'll be surprised how
many database-aware tests you can avoid this way, and as a consequence,
your entire test suite will execute much more quickly.
